name: Trevi Fountain
description: Rome's most famous fountain and a quick-hit stop between other historic sights. The Baroque facade is dramatic in the morning and electric at night, making it an easy anchor for a short photo break.
highlight: Iconic Baroque fountain and coin toss
crowdNote: Crowds peak mid-day; go early or late for space.
hoursNote: Open access site; best lighting early or late.

name: Pantheon
description: A masterpiece of Roman engineering with a massive unreinforced dome and open oculus. The interior is serene and symmetrical, and it fits nicely into a short historic loop with nearby piazzas and cafes.
crowdNote: Steady flow all day; early visits are calmer.
hoursNote: Check official hours for religious services.

name: Vatican Museums
description: A massive museum complex that culminates in the Sistine Chapel. The routes wind through sculpture, tapestries, and the Raphael Rooms, so plan a focused visit if you want to avoid museum fatigue.
crowdNote: Timed tickets recommended; midday queues are long.
hoursNote: Ticketed museum; check the official calendar for closures.
